properties.tree_location: south entrance to the church and gym off or roswell rd
properties.tree_description: 26" Pine

properties.address: 4328 SENTINEL POST RD NW, ATLANTA GA 30327
properties.tree_description:
Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Canopy offset approximately 20 feet from the trunk, with the crown consisting primarily of two overextended leaders. A dead former co-dominant leader attachment site is present. Structural form suggests the tree was previously co-dominant, likely originating as a basal sprout, with one stem lost. The remaining structure exhibits imbalance and extended reach over the adjacent parking area, with targets present.
		
		
			Tree number:2Species:PoplarTree Size (DBH):42Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Sharply co-dominant stems with approximately four feet of continuous bark inclusion. The overall structure suggests a basal sprout origin rather than two independently established trees. Canopy architecture indicates the tree has likely been topped at least twice, resulting in multiple sharply co-dominant unions at different heights. Upon post-inspection review, the subordinate trunk exhibits phototropic lateral growth toward the house and appears to be in close contact with, or rubbing against, a scaffold branch associated with one of the dominant leaders. Historic structural root plate disturbance is present in two locations. The tree is located close to the house, with targets present.
		
		
			Tree number:3Species:Oak Tree Size (DBH):29Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Sharply co-dominant stems with approximately four feet of continuous bark inclusion. The overall structure suggests a basal sprout origin rather than two independently established trees. Canopy architecture indicates the tree has likely been topped at least twice, resulting in multiple sharply co-dominant unions at different heights. Upon post-inspection review, the subordinate trunk exhibits phototropic lateral growth toward the house and appears to be in close contact with, or rubbing against, a scaffold branch associated with one of the dominant leaders. Historic structural root plate disturbance is present in two locations. The tree is located close to the house, with targets present.
		
		
			Tree number:4Species:Hickory Tree Size (DBH):7Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Offset, dog-legged leader structure with one leader decayed and nonviable. The remaining leader is declining and exhibits signs of decay. An adjacent tree under 6 inches DBH is dead and leaning onto the subject tree and is documented here for record purposes only.
		
		
			Tree number:5Species:Oak Tree Size (DBH):11Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tapeReason for Removal:OtherComments:Upper canopy exhibits a lean greater than 20 degrees. A large dead scaffold branch is present, originating from a co-dominant resprout union with a dog-legged configuration, indicating poor structural form and attachment quality.
		
		
			Tree number:6Species:Oak Tree Size (DBH):17Tree location:See site mapDescription of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Canopy dieback is present. A large basal wound is located on the uphill side of the trunk, with visible decay and bark sloughing. An opposing basal cavity is also present, with visible decay and wood loss, indicating circumferential basal compromise.
